result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Heitke

records.addlTxt: 10:05 AM Defendant Michael J. Heitke not in court.  Attorney Richard G. Davis Jr. in court for Michael J. Heitke. Attorney Davis updated the court, matter set for Global Plea Hearing in branch 1 per Attorney Davis, court authorized warrant stayed warrant until 11/8 hearing. 10:08 AM
appointing Atty Richard Davis w/payment schedule
for a pretrial conference 9/9/22 at 9:30 A.M. and return date 10/3/22 at 10:00 A.M.

Defendant appearing on warrant, quashed, prior bond reinstated w/all conditions, Atty Davis has been appointed to represent defendant in other matters, Court will appoint Atty Davis to represent defendant in this matter as well, matter to be reset,
Return date scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
